user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_extended_uname_copy_z:
```c
static ssize_t
get_rq_extended_uname_copy_z (const char *uname_ext, size_t uname_ext_len,
                              char *buf, size_t buf_size)
{
  size_t r;
  size_t w;
  if ((size_t) SSIZE_MAX < uname_ext_len)
    return -1; /* Too long input string */

  if (MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_MIN_LEN > uname_ext_len)
    return -1; /* Required prefix is missing */

  if (! MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ (uname_ext, MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_PREFIX,
                                       MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ( \
                                         MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_PREFIX)))
    return -1; /* Only UTF-8 is supported, as it is implied by RFC 7616 */

  r = MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_PREFIX);
  /* Skip language tag */
  while (r < uname_ext_len && '\'' != uname_ext[r])
  {
    const char chr = uname_ext[r];
    if ((' ' == chr) || ('\t' == chr) || ('\"' == chr) || (',' == chr) ||
        (';' == chr) )
      return -1; /* Wrong char in language tag */
    r++;
  }
  if (r >= uname_ext_len)
    return -1; /* The end of the language tag was not found */
  r++; /* Advance to the next char */

  w = MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_ (uname_ext + r, uname_ext_len - r,
                                    buf, buf_size);
  if ((0 == w) && (0 != uname_ext_len - r))
    return -1; /* Broken percent encoding */
  buf[w] = 0; /* Zero terminate the result */
  mhd_assert (SSIZE_MAX > w);
  return (ssize_t) w;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
if (MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_MIN_LEN > uname_ext_len)
    return -1; /* Required prefix is missing */

if (! MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ (uname_ext, MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_PREFIX,
                                       MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ( \
                                         MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_PREFIX)))
    return -1; /* Only UTF-8 is supported, as it is implied by RFC 7616 */

w = MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_ (uname_ext + r, uname_ext_len - r,
                                    buf, buf_size);

if ((size_t) SSIZE_MAX < uname_ext_len)
    return -1; /* Too long input string */

if ((0 == w) && (0 != uname_ext_len - r))
    return -1; /* Broken percent encoding */
r++; /* Advance to the next char */

if (r >= uname_ext_len)
    return -1; /* The end of the language tag was not found */
explanation: I listed all conditional returns, the percent-decode call, the zero-termination, the assertion and the final return — these are the code locations where control flow could make subsequent code unreachable or where an assertion/cast might cause unreachable behavior and therefore should be investigated for compliance with MISRA C Rule 2.1. Other fragments in the function are simple declarations or straightforward assignments (e.g. "size_t r; size_t w;" and "r = MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_PREFIX);") or comments and do not by themselves create unreachable code paths, so they need not be investigated further for reachability.
